wikipedia_page.main:
Robert Stanton (4 January 1793 – 3 May 1833) was a British businessman, a looking-glass maker and banker who served for two years as a Tory Member of Parliament for the former English parliamentary constituency of Penryn in Cornwall.
After failing as a banker he did not stand again for Parliament. In 1827 he was committed to King's Bench Prison for debt, and was released before he died.

response: * Robert Stanton (merchant), member of the British parliament for Penryn, 1824–1826

* Bob Haymes (1923–1989), American songwriter, actor and television personality who appeared under the names "Bob Stanton" and "Robert Stanton" in the mid-to-late 1940s
* Robert Stanton (park director) (born 1940), director of the United States National Park Service, 1997–2001
* Robert Stanton (actor) (born 1963), American film and television actor
* Robert Stanton (soccer) (born 1972), Australian soccer player of the 1990s–2000s and current coach
